frameDefinitions: A Protagonist is in the dynamic, maintained state of being alive or has exited this state.

An Experiencer actualizes a certain pattern of behavior, a Lifestyle, which persists for a significant period of time in the Experiencer's life and is recognized as part of his character or normal routine.
The words in this frame describe a period of time, as opposed to a point in time.
This frame contains nouns denoting Aggregates of Individuals.
A Person has a particular mental state and the ability to engage in an activity with enthusiasm, energy, and positivity.
This scenario describes a series of Events, associated with a single Participant, i.e., the history of the Participant.
frameExamples: He <t>lived</t> a hedonistic life before he settled down.
The best <t>time</t> of year for planting tends to be fairly regular.
An <t><fex name='Agg'>army</fex></t> of postal workers descended on my office.
We've been worried about our recent hire's <t><fex name='Events'>history</fex></t> of deceiving employers.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Protagonist</fen> identifies the being or entity that is  dead or alive.
This role identifies the <fen>Figure</fen> or form being described by the target.
The time in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is dead or alive.
The person who actualizes a pattern of behavior.
A pattern of behavior which the actions of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> matches for a significant period of time.
The <fen>Lifestyle</fen> may be characterized by a <fen>Manner</fen>, which is often expressed adverbially.
A temporal description of when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> adopts a <fen>Lifestyle</fen>.
The spatial location where the <fen>Experiencer</fen> carries out a <fen>Lifestyle</fen>.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>State</fen>'s duration.  In this frame, the duration can be inexact.
An ongoing state whose duration can be measured.
This role identifies the people or things that form  the <fen>Aggregate</fen>.
This role identifies the collection of entities that are the <fen>Aggregate</fen>.
The person who is evaluated for a level of enthusiasm.

The <fen>Participant</fen> is either an active participant in all of the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Agent or Patient), or is more peripherally associated with the <fen>Events</fen> (e.g., Location or Topic).
The <fen>Events</fen> which the <fen>Participant</fen> is a part of. This role is used to mark the frame-evoking element.
listRoleExamples: He lived <fex>the life of a beggar</fex>.
<fex>He was a great actor</fex> in his time.
A crowd <fex>of hoodlums</fex> filled the plaza.
A <fex><t>crowd</t></fex> of hoodlums filled the plaza.
We've been worried about <fex>our recent hire's</fex> history of deceiving employers.
We will focus on events in her recent <fex>history</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the last day of the season
the end of the financial year
